Static Public Member Functions

(id) + defaultTracker

Detailed Description

A class representing an ongoing application session for tracking purposes.

Member Function Documentation

+ (id) defaultTracker

Returns the singleton instance of the DMTracker.

- (void) startApp

Initialize the tracker for a new session with your app.

- (void) stopApp

Finalize the current app session. Only valid a single time after a call to startApp. It is implicitly called when the app sends a NSApplicationWillTerminateNotification. Finalizing the app session will attempt to send all queued messages. If it fails, they will be attempted sent at the next app startup.

See also:
NSApplicationWillTerminateNotification
- (void) trackCustomDataRealtimeWithName: (NSString *)  theName
value: (NSString *)  theValue 

Track a custom data entry in realtime. This is a real-time event that is attempted sent immediately. It will be cached for delayed sending if there's no internet connection or another error occurs.

Parameters:
theNameThe name of the data you're logging.
theValueThe value of this entry.
- (void) trackCustomDataWithName: (NSString *)  theName
value: (NSString *)  theValue 

Track a custom data entry.

Parameters:
theNameThe name of the data you're logging.
theValueThe value of this entry.
- (void) trackEventInCategory: (NSString *)  theCategory
withName: (NSString *)  theName 

Track an event. This is a batched event that will be sent when the app exits.

Parameters:
theCategoryThe category of the event.
theNameThe name of the event.
- (void) trackEventInCategory: (NSString *)  theCategory
withName: (NSString *)  theName
secondsSpent: (int)  theSeconds
completed: (BOOL)  wasCompleted 

Track an event related to a timed operation. This is a batched event that will be sent when the app exits.

Parameters:
theCategoryThe category of the event.
theNameThe name of the event.
theSecondsThe number of seconds the operation took to complete.
wasCompletedWhether or not the operation completed successfully.

Track an event. This is a batched event that will be sent when the app exits.

Parameters:
theCategoryThe category of the event.
theNameThe name of the event.
theValueThe event value
- (void) trackException: (NSException *)  theException

Track an exception. This is a real-time event that is attempted sent immediately. It will be cached for delayed sending if there's no internet connection or another error occurs.

Parameters:
theExceptionThe exception you're logging.
- (void) trackLog: (NSString *)  theMessage

Track a log entry. This is a batched event that will be sent when the app exits.

Parameters:
theMessageThe message you want to log.
